entry.title: ROSEBURG WOMAN DIES, SECOND DRIVER INJURED IN HEAD-ON CRASH ON FRIDAY
entry.summary: August 10, 2025 5:30 p.m. A Roseburg woman died, and the second driver was injured in a two-vehicle head-on crash on Friday morning. A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said shortly after 7:30 a.m., 911 dispatchers began receiving calls regarding the wreck on Garden Valley Road near Ridgewood Drive, northwest of Roseburg. entry.title: DFPA CREWS DEAL WITH DOLE ROAD FIRE ON SATURDAY
entry.summary: August 10, 2025 1:45 p.m. Crews with the Douglas Forest Protection Association dealt with a fire on Dole Road near Interstate 5 in the area of the Clarks Branch Road exit on Saturday. DFPA Public Information Officer Rachel Pope said ground and aviation resources quickly contained the forward spread of the 2.8 acre which was...

entry.title: DFPA WITH FINAL UPDATE FOR BURNT MOUNTAIN FIRE
entry.summary: August 10, 2025 1:30 p.m. The Douglas Forest Protective Association and contract crews have made significant progress on the estimated 20-acre Burnt Mountain Fire, north of Tenmile, and have issued the final update. DFPA Public Information Officer Rachel Pope said the fire began on Friday afternoon. As of Saturday evening, mop-up of 50-100 feet on...

entry.title: HEAT ADVISORY THROUGH EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING
entry.summary: August 10, 2025 5:00 a.m. A Heat Advisory is in effect through early Wednesday morning for central Douglas County. entry.title: BURNT MOUNTAIN FIRE AT 20 ACRES AS OF MID-DAY SATURDAY

entry.summary: GLENDALE — Douglas County Sheriff's Office is asking for public assistance in locating Owen Weese, 39, last seen at approximately 9:45 p.m. Wednesday when he was dropped off near milepost 6.1 on Windy Creek Road in Glendale.

entry.title: Remembering the Roseburg Blast: August 7, 1959
entry.summary: 66 years ago today, the Roseburg Blast devastated downtown Roseburg, Oregon. The 1959 explosion destroyed city blocks, claimed lives, and forever changed the community, leaving a legacy of resilience and remembrance that endures each August 7th.

entry.title: Remembering the 1959 Roseburg blast
entry.summary: Early Aug. 7, 1959, a red truck loaded with explosives erupted in downtown Roseburg, killing 14 people, injuring more than 120 and flattening entire blocks of the city’s core.

entry.title: Bicyclist struck and killed by vehicle in Douglas County crash
